page.title: 062 Arable Farms,Bromley,S.E.
page.content: Court Lodge Farm is an arable farm of 172 acres.The original 6000 acres has been reduced through compulsory purchase for building.Barley, wheat, oats and green vegetables are grown in the chalky soil,but E.E.C. regulations restrict the amount of crops grown. A tractor and combine harvester have replaced 30 working horses,and there are now 2 full time workers and 1 part-time worker in place of 130. Charmwood Farm covers 320 acres.It used to be a dairy farm,but is now used mainly for crops.The best crop financially is oil seed rape. The farmer aims for 3 tons an acre of wheat,21\2 tons an acre of barley and 1 ton for an acre of oil seed rape.80 cows,mainly Hereford-cross Friesans are kept in winter.
